top_tracks.name: Plastic Beach (Feat. Mick Jones & Paul Simonon)

narrative.narrative:
# Your 2024 Symphony of Chaos

Alright, let's talk about your year. You pressed play **5,964 times** and racked up **375 hours** of listening time. That's basically 15.6 days straight of music. Did you even listen to silence this year, or is that concept foreign to you now?

## The Kendrick Lamar Fan Club (Population: You)

You spent **85 hours** with Kendrick Lamar. EIGHTY-FIVE HOURS. That's more time than most people spend with their actual therapist. And judging by your obsession with "Die Hard" (146 plays) and "Father Time" (86 plays), you weren't just vibing—you were *processing*. "Rich (interlude)" got 89 plays, and it's literally 1 minute and 43 seconds long. You okay, friend?

## The Holy Trinity of Hip-Hop

Your top three artists—Kendrick, Chance the Rapper, and Ye—occupied **197 hours** of your year. That's a whole college course worth of content, except instead of a degree, you got *feelings* and the ability to rap every word of "No Problem."

Speaking of Chance: you played "All Night" **183 times**. And we know about that one day in September when you played it **86 times in 24 hours**. That's not listening, that's a spiritual experience. That's a cry for help. That's art.

## The Plot Twist

But wait—in the middle of all this hip-hop excellence, there's Gorillaz. You played "To Binge" 112 times like a melancholic indie kid hiding inside a hip-hop head's body. And somehow, "I'm Flying Away" by The Dead Milkmen snuck into your top 10? **85 plays?** The chaotic energy is strong with this one.

## Your Listening Habits Are... Telling

You're a **10 AM warrior**. That's when you hit peak listening mode (704 plays that hour). Most people are barely through their first coffee, and you're already on your third spin of "Blessings." Mondays were your biggest day—apparently you *really* need music to survive the weekly existential dread.

But here's the real tea: you basically didn't listen to music for half the year. January, March, April, July? Ghost town. Then **August hit** and you remembered music exists, spiraling into a 4-month binge that peaked in **October** with 1,855 plays. What happened? New job? Breakup? Discovered headphones?

## The Late Night Confession

Your late-night anthem was "Redbone" by Childish Gambino (24 plays after midnight). Nothing says "3 AM introspection" quite like that falsetto. We see you, lying in the dark, questioning your life choices.

## The Grand Finale

You maintained a **37-day listening streak** at some point. That's dedication. That's commitment. That's someone who understands that life without a soundtrack is just... existing.

**Coloring Book** was your album of the year with 809 plays—over 50 hours of Chance's gospel-rap glory. You weren't just listening; you were attending church.

So here's to 2024: the year you turned music into a lifestyle, Kendrick into a life coach, and "All Night" into your personality. Same time next year? 🎵

personality.tagline: Bumping Kendrick at 10 AM like it's a spiritual practice
personality.description: You've achieved peak enlightenment: listening to 'All Night' by Chance 183 times while somehow maintaining a work schedule. Your 9-5 is really a 9-5 Kendrick marathon, with 22% of your entire year dedicated to the holy trinity of Kendrick, Chance, and Ye. You played 'All Night' 86 times in one day—that's not a listening session, that's a religious experience. Your coworkers think you work from home, but really you're in a booth at the church of West Coast conscious rap, taking communion with MF DOOM and OutKast. Late nights belong to Childish Gambino's 'Redbone' (24 times past midnight because existential crises need a soundtrack). You're either writing a thesis on hip-hop philosophy or you just really, really love hitting replay.
personality.spirit_animal: A monk who only meditates to trap beats

roasts: You played 'All Night' by Chance 86 times in ONE DAY. That's not appreciation, that's a hostage situation.
You listened to a 1:43 interlude called 'Rich' 89 times. We get it, you're manifesting prosperity through Kendrick's ad-libs.
22% of your ENTIRE year was just Kendrick Lamar. At this point, you don't listen to music—you're in a parasocial relationship with Kung Fu Kenny.
Your listening peaked at 10 AM on a Monday. Nothing says 'thriving at work' like drowning out your responsibilities with 'Die Hard' for the 146th time.
You went from 38 plays in January to 1,855 in October. Either you discovered headphones in August or had a very specific mental breakdown we should discuss.

aura.description: Your aura radiates the warmth of spiritual hip-hop and the depth of lyrical meditation. Like Kendrick's introspection meeting Chance's gospel-infused optimism, you exist in the space where thought-provoking bars meet soulful celebration. Your energy peaks during morning work hours (9-11 AM), suggesting a ritualistic approach to music—not just background noise, but a daily practice of elevation. The heavy rotation of 'All Night' and 'Die Hard' reveals someone who finds comfort in vulnerability and isn't afraid to sit with complex emotions. You're drawn to artists who challenge themselves and their listeners, favoring albums that demand multiple listens to fully unpack. Your musical spirit is equal parts consciousness and joy, forever seeking that balance between being woke and being blessed.

superlatives.award: The 'Hit Replay One More Time' Award
superlatives.reason: Played 'All Night' by Chance the Rapper 86 times in a single day on September 1st. At that point, it wasn't just a vibe, it was a lifestyle.

superlatives.award: Most Likely to Start a Kendrick Lamar Fan Club
superlatives.reason: Spent 85+ hours listening to Kendrick Lamar (1,308 plays). That's nearly 4 full days of pure Kung Fu Kenny - basically a PhD in his discography.

superlatives.award: The '9-to-5 But Make It Hip-Hop' Award
superlatives.reason: Peak listening hours between 9 AM and 2 PM with over 3,000 plays during work hours. Turning spreadsheets into rap battles, one Ye verse at a time.

superlatives.award: Most Committed to a 37-Day Music Marathon
superlatives.reason: Maintained a 37-day listening streak. That's over a month of never letting the music stop - even bathroom breaks came with a soundtrack.
Played Chance the Rapper's Coloring Book 809 times (51+ hours). At this point, you don't just know the album, the album knows YOU.

hot_takes: You listened to 'All Night' 86 times in ONE DAY... either you discovered the best song ever or your repeat button is stuck and you're too stubborn to admit it
Spending 85+ hours with Kendrick this year but only 136 tracks with MF DOOM? That's like saying you're a hip-hop head but only visiting the penthouse, never the underground
Your November 4th spiral with 131 plays suggests you either had a *really* productive work-from-home day or were avoiding something important. Both are valid.
You're out here treating a 1:43 interlude (Rich) like it's a full song with 89 plays. Tell me you're procrastinating without telling me you're procrastinating
110 unique artists but half your year is just three dudes. This isn't musical diversity, this is a parasocial relationship with early 2010s hip-hop

suggestions: You listened to 'All Night' by Chance 86 times in ONE DAY (Sept 1st). That's not listening, that's a spiritual experience. Time to explore Chance's earlier work—Acid Rap will hit different.
You spent 85+ hours with Kendrick this year (that's like watching The Godfather 50 times). His collab albums are calling: check out 'Black Panther: The Album' for that same introspective energy.
Your 10 AM-2 PM window is prime hip-hop hours (2,585 plays!). 2025 prediction: You're going to discover J. Cole's 'The Off-Season' during a Wednesday morning work session and never look back.
Gorillaz's 'Plastic Beach' got 245 plays—you clearly vibe with experimental hip-hop. Next up: try BROCKHAMPTON or early Pharrell/N.E.R.D. for that same genre-bending energy.

With OutKast, N.W.A, and The Pharcyde in your top 10, you're a hip-hop historian. 2025 mission: dive into A Tribe Called Quest's discography if you haven't already. 'Midnight Marauders' is your next obsession.
